alert.note: Alert for Canyonlands, Natural Bridges; La Sal and Abajo Mountains; Southeast Utah (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 29 at 7:51AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible, especially on burn scars and areas with already saturated soil. * WHERE...Portions of Colorado and southeast Utah, including the following areas, in Colorado, Animas River Basin, Four Corners/Upper Dolores River, Northwest San Juan Mountains, Paradox Valley/Lower Dolores River, San Juan River Basin, Southwest San Juan Mountains and Uncompahgre Plateau and Dallas Divide. In southeast Utah, Canyonlands/Natural Bridges, La Sal and Abajo Mountains and Southeast Utah. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. In addition, heavy rainfall over recent burn scars such as the Pack Creek Fire, Ice Fire, 416 Fire and East Canyon Fire burn areas, among other smaller, more recent burn areas in the watch area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Deep monsoonal moisture will remain across the region resulting in widespread showers and thunderstorms. Heavy rain, flash flooding and debris flows will be possible, especially over recent burn scars and already saturated soils from recent rainfall.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Canyonlands, Natural Bridges; La Sal and Abajo Mountains; Southeast Utah
